result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Scott Severson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution to be converted into civil judgment

Defendant granted Huber privileges under rules and regulations of the Columbia County Jail, the A.T.R. defendant participated in does not count towards sentence credit, defendant may serve sentence in Rock County

10/21/16 - AMENDED - Huber privileges suspended for 10 days due to jail violations

10/27/16 - AMENDED - Loss of 1 day Good Time due to jail violations
Consecutive to: any other sentence

Defendant Daniel Scott Severson in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 4, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 1, 2, and Ct. 5 dismissed, read in, Court sentences defendant to: 4 months jail w/Huber, consecutive to any other sentence, the A.T.R. defendant participated in does not count towards sentence credit, Jail start date 09/16/16 at 7:00 P.M., may serve sentence in Rock County, $518.00 costs, $550.00 Restitution converted into civil judgment, Defendant to submit DNA Sample, Firearms restriction,
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Scheduling Order
Jury trial on July 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel Scott Severson in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Waiver is not based on an agreement.   Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued. Twenty days to file motions.

Attorney Peter Michael Masana appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant serving an ATR at present time. Reset requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Peter Michael Masana appeared. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is currently incarcerated.  Atty Masana requested a preliminary hearing.  State had no objection.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Appointed Attorney Peter Masana

Defendant Daniel Scott Severson in court, in custody.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No pretrial was held, due to defendant being in custody.  Defendant would like an atty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 02:10 pm.  Return date scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Daniel Scott Severson in court, in custody by video with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Jane E.
